intro: Descurainia minutiflora, commonly known as stinkweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It features small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. It has a distinctive musty odor, which is most noticeable when the leaves are crushed.
